headline: Disney taps parks head Josh D'Amaro as CEO to lead post-Iger era
summary: STORY: Walt Disney named theme parks head Josh D'Amaro as CEO on Tuesday (February 3).It ends years of questions about who would take over from current boss Bob Iger.54-year-old D'Amaro is due to start the role in March.He's a longtime Disney insider and takes charge as AI and a wave of consolidation hits the media industry.Iger is credited with shaping the modern Disney.That's largely through deals for huge production brands like Pixar, Lucasfilm and 21st Century Fox.Succession questions have long been a weakness for the entertainment giant.It has delayed Iger's retirement a number of times.Iger also returned four years ago to replace his chosen successor, Bob Chapek, after the pandemic hurt business.D'Amaro currently runs Disney's experiences unit, which is the company's biggest profit engine and makes up almost 60% of earnings.The unit includes theme parks and cruises.Sales have grown every year in the division after the pandemic slowed five years ago.And it scored a record operating profit of nearly $10 billion last year.But a recent fall in international visitors to the U.S. has weighed.Analysts have also said D'Amaro is little known in Hollywood.It could be a challenge when generative AI tools threaten to reshape the entertainment business.And a new round of labor negotiations are due to begin this year with the industry's major guilds.Competition has also grown as Netflix and Paramount try to buy Warner Bros assets.Either combination is expected to lead to a major streaming and studio rival.

raw.headline: Disney taps parks head Josh D'Amaro as CEO to lead post-Iger era
raw.summary: STORY: Walt Disney named theme parks head Josh D'Amaro as CEO on Tuesday (February 3).It ends years of questions about who would take over from current boss Bob Iger.54-year-old D'Amaro is due to start the role in March.He's a longtime Disney insider and takes charge as AI and a wave of consolidation hits the media industry.Iger is credited with shaping the modern Disney.That's largely through deals for huge production brands like Pixar, Lucasfilm and 21st Century Fox.Succession questions have long been a weakness for the entertainment giant.It has delayed Iger's retirement a number of times.Iger also returned four years ago to replace his chosen successor, Bob Chapek, after the pandemic hurt business.D'Amaro currently runs Disney's experiences unit, which is the company's biggest profit engine and makes up almost 60% of earnings.The unit includes theme parks and cruises.Sales have grown every year in the division after the pandemic slowed five years ago.And it scored a record operating profit of nearly $10 billion last year.But a recent fall in international visitors to the U.S. has weighed.Analysts have also said D'Amaro is little known in Hollywood.It could be a challenge when generative AI tools threaten to reshape the entertainment business.And a new round of labor negotiations are due to begin this year with the industry's major guilds.Competition has also grown as Netflix and Paramount try to buy Warner Bros assets.Either combination is expected to lead to a major streaming and studio rival.

headline: What does new Disney CEO Josh D'Amaro need to do to boost stock?
summary: Disney (DIS) has officially tapped Josh D'Amaro, the chairman of its parks and experiences division, to take over as CEO effective March 18. Bloomberg Intelligence senior media analyst Geetha Ranganathan comments on what D'Amaro can do or the areas he will focus on to help raise Disney's stock. Also watch Geetha Ranganathan explain why Josh D'Amaro taking the helm will "underscore" the importance of Disney's theme parks. headline: Disney earnings to pickup in second half of 2026 on streaming and parks strength
summary: Investing.com -- Walt Disney’s shares still offer upside as profits are set to grow at a double-digit pace from fiscal 2026, driven by improving streaming results and steadier growth at its parks business, Morgan Stanley analysts say. The Walt Disney Company has also announced Tuesday that Josh D’Amaro will become the company’s next Chief Executive Officer, effective March 18, 2026, succeeding Robert A. Iger.

headline: Disney names theme parks chief Josh D'Amaro as next CEO
summary: The Walt Disney Company announced Tuesday that Josh D'Amaro, head of its theme parks division, will replace Bob Iger as chief executive when the entertainment titan steps down in March.In a concurrent move, Dana Walden, co-chairman of Disney Entertainment, was named president and chief creative officer -- a new role in which she will report directly to D'Amaro and oversee creative output across the company.

raw.headline: Disney names theme parks chief Josh D'Amaro as next CEO
raw.summary: The Walt Disney Company announced Tuesday that Josh D'Amaro, head of its theme parks division, will replace Bob Iger as chief executive when the entertainment titan steps down in March.In a concurrent move, Dana Walden, co-chairman of Disney Entertainment, was named president and chief creative officer -- a new role in which she will report directly to D'Amaro and oversee creative output across the company.

headline: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Palantir, Teradyne, Tesla, AMD, NXP Semiconductors, and More
summary: Stock futures were rising Tuesday as Palantir’s strong earnings injected renewed optimism around the artificial-intelligence trade.  Palantir Technologies  jumped 10% in premarket trading after the company, which sells artificial-intelligence software to manage and analyze large amounts of data, reported better-than expected fourth-quarter adjusted earnings.  Revenue jumped 70% from a year earlier to a record $1.41 billion on strong demand for its AI technology.

headline: Disney Names Parks Chief D’Amaro as New CEO, Succeeding Iger
summary: Disney  has named  Josh D’Amaro  as its new chief executive officer, putting the man in charge of the theme parks and cruise ships, which have become its biggest source of profits, atop America’s best-known entertainment brand.  D’Amaro will succeed  Bob Iger  to become the ninth leader of Disney in its 102-year history.  D’Amaro won a challenging bake-off for the job against Disney’s entertainment co-Chairman  Dana Walden  that has been the talk of Hollywood for more than a year.

raw.headline: Disney Names Parks Chief D’Amaro as New CEO, Succeeding Iger

D’Amaro will succeed  Bob Iger  to become the ninth leader of Disney in its 102-year history.  D’Amaro won a challenging bake-off for the job against Disney’s entertainment co-Chairman  Dana Walden  that has been the talk of Hollywood for more than a year.

headline: US Stock Market Today S&P 500 Futures Edge Higher As Factory Strength Supports Growth

The ISM Manufacturing PMI, a key scorecard for factory activity, sits at 52.6 for January 2026, which signals expanding output and potentially firmer demand for goods. At the same time, the 10 year Treasury yield around 4.27% keeps borrowing costs...

headline: Why Disney's succession plan is so critical
summary: For the better part of the last 20 years, Disney has been led by Bob Iger. He tried to step away in 2020 after picking Disney parks head Bob Chapek to take on the role. The succession was a failure, filled with public controversies and internal turmoil at the company. Iger stepped back in as CEO in 2022 to right the ship and is now being replaced once again — this time for good, he says. CNBC's Lillian Rizzo breaks down why it is such a big deal that Disney has a new leader at the helm.
